column4: I have a lot of services running from the directory /var/tmp/Shit/ as the user "rsync".. Has my linux-box been hacked?
Several sshd processes and pscan2 is being run by that user, and in the dir I've got a lot of files e.g. vuln.txt and pass.txt
Kinda sounds like it. take a look at the output of 'netstat -tunlp'
what should I be looking for?
Anything odd
there's nothing odd in there.. my webserver and X ports..
You can pastebin the output if you want somebody else to take a look
If you have another computer you might want to disconnect that one from the net until you're sure its ok
here you go: http://www.pastebin.org/14138
I just killed all processes running as "rsync". That seemed to deal with most of the disturbance..
I just opened the vuln.txt.. There is 10 IP addresses of servers, and root logins for every one of them.. That's definately not good
nope
You might want to consider backing up personal data and reinstalling.
I will ;) thank you for the help..
Judging from the Mar 25 2006 dates, either your date is wrong, or this machine has been compromised for quite some time
My time is right, and the machine was installed a week ago..
It looks like the attacker used pscan2 to scan your subnet 20 hosts at a time
it's the only host on my subnet except for my laptop and my WRT54GL :D
but he also scanned a lot of outside IP
Hmm, maybe it was somebody elses
and the positive results are written in the vuln.txt file.. I'm getting rid of that..
You could try to identify the hosts and let them know if you felt like being nice :)
